Package entity

Class Player

java.lang.Object
interfaces.Moveable
entity.Player
public class Player extends Moveable
Represents a player.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(double x, double y)
      Constructs a new Player object. The health of all players is initially set to 100 and is in the range (0, 100]. Players start with $100, a Pistol, and no armor or other usable items.
      Parameters:
      x - the initial x position of this player.
      y - the initial y position of this player.

  • Method Details

    • getHealth

      public int getHealth()
      Returns the health of this player.
      Returns:
      the health of this player.

    • isDead

      public boolean isDead()
      Determines if this player is dead.
      Returns:
      whether this player is dead. That is, whether getHealth() <= 0.

    • getMoney

      public int getMoney()
      Returns the amount of money this player has.
      Returns:
      the amount of money this player has.

    • getWeapon

      public Weapon getWeapon()
      Returns this player's weapon.
      Returns:
      this player's weapon.

    • isArmored

      public boolean isArmored()
      Returns whether this player is wearing armor.
      Returns:
      whether this player is wearing armor.

    • getItem

      public Item getItem(int itemNum)
      Gets the specified item from the player's list of items. The itemNum is not an index into the items list. Instead, it is the number of the usable item, which excludes any armor that the player may have.

      For instace, if the player has the items [HealthKit, Armor, Grenade], then getItem(1) will return the health kit and getItem(2) will return the grenade. Any other value of itemNum will yield null.

      Parameters:
      itemNum - the item number to get.
      Returns:
      the item corresponding to the specified item number, or null if that item number does not exist.

    • damage

      public void damage(int damage)
      Reduces the player's health.
      Parameters:
      damage - the amount to reduce from the player's health.

    • pay

      public void pay(int money)
      Gives the player more money.
      Parameters:
      money - the amount of money to give to the player.

    • buy

      public boolean buy(Item item)
      Attempts to buy a new item and returns the status of the purchase. If the item was successfully purchased, this method will automatically reduce the player's money and give them the item. This method prevents buying the same weapon that the player already has, and prevents over-buying on other items.
      Parameters:
      item - the item to buy.
      Returns:
      whether the item was successfully purchased.

    • give

      public void give(Item item)
      Gives this player an item. If the specified item is a Weapon, the player's current weapon is replaced by the given weapon. Otherwise, the item is added to the player's list of items.
      Parameters:
      item - the item to give the player.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if item == null.

    • use

      public boolean use(int itemNum)
      Uses an item owned by this player. If the item is used successfully, the action of the item is automatically performed and the item is taken away from the player.
      Parameters:
      itemNum - the item number to use.
      Returns:
      whether the specified item was used.
      See Also:
      • getItem(int)

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the player's information, excluding position. The reset consists of setting the player's health and lastWalked information, and zeroing the velocity.

    • move

      public void move()
      Description copied from class: Moveable
      Moves this object based on the velocity assigned to it. This is achieved by adding the x and y components of the velocity to the respective position components. This operation is strictly an addition, so velocity should be negative to move left or up.
      Overrides:
      move in class Moveable

    • getType

      public String getType()
      Returns the type of the player. The type is either "PlayerShort" or "PlayerLong" depending on the type of weapon being carried by the player.
      Specified by:
      getType in class Moveable
      Returns:
      the type of the player.
